New Records: South Africa ended their 24-year wait for a win over New Zealand
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen's double strike lifted South Africa in the first Powerplay
Gerald Coetzee and Kagiso Rabada followed up with wickets of their own
Keshav Maharaj struck four times to ensure a dominant South Africa win
Rassie van der Dussen was the Player of the Match for his brilliant 133
Devon Conway was caught by Aiden Markram in the first Powerplay
Ravindra was caught at fine leg by Marco Jansen in the ninth over
Gerald Coetzee had Will Young caught behind with a peach
Kagiso Rabada had Tom Latham caught in the covers
Southee accounted for de Kock in the 40th over
David Miller and Rassie van der Dussen added a quickfire 78 for the third wicket
South Africa hit a total of nine sixes in the final Powerplay
Temba Bavuma was undone by Trent Boult
Rassie van der Dussen hit a confident fifty in Pune
De Kock reached his half-century, his fourth fifty-plus score of the tournament, in the 21st over
De Kock brought up his fourth Cricket World Cup hundred with a maximum off Neesham in the 36th over
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa were sitting second in the standings, one spot ahead of New Zealand, with five wins
New Zealand will be out to get their Cricket World Cup campaign back on track after four initial victories were followed by back-to-back losses to India and Australia
A third consecutive loss would leave the Black Caps well within reach of the chasing pack led by Pakistan and Afghanistan
New Zealand hold a 6-2 advantage over South Africa at past ICC Men's Cricket World Cups and are currently on a streak of five consecutive wins in head-to-head encounters at the tournament
Another semi-final clash would be on the cards if South Africa (second) and New Zealand (third) hold onto their current positions in the standings
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa ended their 24-year wait for a win over New Zealand
Rassie van der Dussen was the Player of the Match for his brilliant 133
Temba Bavuma said that they would've batted first anyhow. He expressed that the wicket was on the drier side and that the ball might skid in the evening
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa have been shakier when chasing a target, falling 38 runs short of the 246 that Netherlands set for them for what turned into their only defeat at the tournament so far, and later staggering to the line for a less-than-convincing one-wicket victory against Pakistan
New Zealand will be out to get their Cricket World Cup campaign back on track after four initial victories were followed by back-to-back losses to India and Australia
South Africa fast bowler Gerald Coetzee is making the most of his opportunity at the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup 2023
New Zealand pacer Trent Boult is again making an impact at an ICC Men's Cricket World Cup as the Black Caps surge towards a semi-final berth
Others: South Africa squad: Temba Bavuma (c), Quinton de Kock (wk), Rassie van der Dussen, Aiden Markram, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Marco Jansen, Gerald Coetzee, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Lungi Ngidi
New Zealand squad: Devon Conway, Will Young, Rachin Ravindra, Daryl Mitchell, Tom Latham (c) (wk), Glenn Phillips, James Neesham, Mitchell Santner, Matt Henry, Tim Southee, Trent Boult
